title: Azir's Soldiers should have a time bar over them.
body: Title, with all forms of cc and zyras plants and such having timers I think Azir's soldiers should follow suit and have a timer for the sake of the people playing as and against azir.

replies.body: They do have a "timer" of sorts in that they start to shed a ton of sand before they vanish, it is best when playing Azir that your opponents don't quiet know when ur soldiers will vanish giving u an edge in that they don't know if its safe to move up yet or not. If it was just an indicator for Azir like a little sun disk icon over the soldiers that slowly vanished over time in a clock like fashion I would be ok with that just to help some of the newer people pick him up but at the same time I like that he's not too popular cuz I love to play him and love not having to compete in lobby for him lol
So just make it so only azir can see the time bar, like Udyr's stun refresh timer and Nautilus root refresh timer. Problem solved.

> So just make it so only azir can see the time bar, like Udyr's stun refresh timer and Nautilus root refresh timer. Problem solved.

This. Quality of life
This is perfect.
This deserves an upvote for pointing this out. I still think a private bar would be better. Especially since most other similar mecanics seem to have it.
I never noticed that until you pointed it out! that's a pretty cool feature.

We tried this in a bunch of different ways (depleting health bar like wards, circular timer like Yasuo E target indicator) and found that players don't ACTUALLY want this. You seem to think you do, but the information you're looking for is "will this soldier time out in the near future?" Information noise is a real thing and players were actually harder pressed to make decisions around soldiers with this excessive bit of information, so we stripped it out and decided to give the "about to time out" notice instead. You're picking up on that one, right?

>You're picking up on that one, right?

It's too subtle and doesn't actually give much clear info. I would much, MUCH prefer a proper timer.

Zenon has a point.
But I rarely have time to notice the sand soldier's decay warning before it's to late to even launch it in a suicide or prep another soldier. Maybe it's me lacking instinctive timing of their lifespan, but for now its only use is telling me I have will loose ground. 
I don't know how long it is, but I feel like the warning only lasts 1 second at best. The question is : is it really that short or do I always notice it half way?

You're picking up on that one, right?

Maybe just a thematic visual indicator like a circle of sand around them as their range indicator, disappearing to reveal the one we currently have until it is completely gone. It doesn't even need to be visible to anyone else

I think it would be really easy just to have the targeting ring around the soldiers change based off whether or not you're in range to make them AA, look at Yasuo's Q, when he gets a tornado preped he gets a range indicator around himself that is grey to start and when the spell comes off CD it turns a pale opaque blue, we could incorporate something similar for Azir soldiers and whether or not u can attack with them (the soldiers range ring turning opaque should u be in range to attack with it and faded grey when not)

You seem to think you do, but the information you're looking for is "will this soldier time out in the near future?" You're picking up on that one, right?

What about making the soldier lose colors, and go gray-er the longer he's up? Finally going full gray scale when vanishing

To me, a lot of the notices on Azir's soldiers are far too subtle. I have difficulty noticing if my soldiers are near enough to attack (they change their stance) and when soldiers are about to time out (they start to crumble). 

It might partly be because the soldiers themselves do not stand out enough on the live version of summoners rift or because there are a lot of other things that you also have to pay attention to; but since the soldiers are so integral to his kit, I think that everything about them should be VERY obvious at least to the Azir player. Would it be possible to integrate color changes or pulsing effects on the soldiers attack range indicators to make these bits of information more readable?
what if the sand icon on top of them act like an hourglass, with when no sand left mean the soldier vanish.

a little bit more forewarning on the time out would be good, and a little bit earlier for the warning too plz, something with the sand leash maybe just because I've had times where I've had a soldier behind me and I moved my camera forwards and tried to Q only to realize I have no soldier to fling cuz he already timed out or was so close to timing out I couldn't throw him forwards (when I moved up my camera the soldier went off screen). Also just for usefulness sake can we please make it so you can fling a soldier right up until it is about to expire and have it still arrive at its location then immediately melt? Cuz when they are moving like that I feel their timers should be suspended until they are still again as they do turn into projectiles while moving and it is kinda a pain if your projectile vanishes half way along the trajectory :(

There's a number of ways you can accomplish this without creating too much visual noise.  You can link some effect to the tether, so we sort of see the visual that the tether is breaking OR you can even put an icon above the ability bar that has a circular wipe timer for how long the soldiers' are alive.

Wasn't you goal once to make the game more transparent an easy to pick up?
Sure somebody who can count down the time of 3 soldiers at the same time has some great brain and skills.
Yet I think this overcomplicates thing  and baits players into stupid action.
A time bar helps everybody to make calls and judge the situation better.

The 'about to time out' notice is clear with the default skin "spiral sand effect with an audio cue." However, using Galatic Azir. the soldier's 'about to time out' notice is really difficult to see. This may be a brightness or particle density issue when compared to his default skin.

My suggestion is to use Galatic Azir's recall 'beam up' circles. I think it fits the theme nicely and is much clearer to pick up.

Was a Syndra-style "soldiers become visually different/unstable" tested out?

If not, I think that would be the best solution (plus having the soldiers slowly decaying during the last 2 seconds of their lifespan would look awesome.)
Azir had a timer during testing. But Riot decided it was too 'noisy' and removed it.
Yet they added little arrows above them to help you know where they are. I don't see how they couldn't change or re-purpose them to add a timer functionality.

Definitely reasonable. It would give him the clarity the claim to aim for on every champion. I see no reason for him to be an exception.

Clarity to the user preferably but if they make it available to everyone whatever.
I'd prefer the "timer ring." Mostly because a timer bar doesn't work on something you can't target and doesn't have a stat bar.

There already is a quality of life built into his kit. The soldiers start to deteriorate and their AA circles slowly fade away. Plenty of indication for Azir he doesn't need more to help the enemy team abuse him. The ult "bug-fixes" really nerfed him hard. He doesn't need people able to see his soldiers timers.

Plus he got little to no compensation for said bug fixes. Bouncing somebody multiple times is a huge part of his kit and he's still sub-40%. Now I want to say about 5%-8% of that WR is due to noobs playing him. That will put him at a 40-45% WR. 

Pinning people to walls is a huge design over look not a bug. And half the time it didn't even pin people. It would bounce them on the same soldier over and over again until they gained enough speed to break onto the other side of the wall (takes about .5s in most scenarios that I've seen). That would apply damage one time (each soldier was applying damage up to 1 time per soldier). Taking away damage on multiple hits with the wall was probably the dumb part. So someone jumps into my wall like an idiot after I put it up and doesn't get damaged for it? Why would you take that away? Especially when the wall is notorious for not pushing people away a good 25% of the time. 

I can go on and on about all the meaningful bugs to Azir's kit all day but Riot addresses some of the most frequent but least harmful ones. You know how annoying it is using an ult to shove an ulting Nasus away just to have him stand there like "nice wall imma Q stack you now"? Extremely annoying.
Can we get a arrow showing how far away we can be from the sand soldiers also? That'd be pretty nice.
It's sad that Riot didn't implement this to begin with, it would really help with clarity and usability for {{champion:268}} .
This would be a nice quality of live change. sadly he'd still face the problem that half of his kit simply doesn't work a it should during 50%of the time.
Do you think that a timer like the one that is used for Thresh's lantern could be considered?
Shaco players have been asking for this over the Clone for ages. Still nothing.
